Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Sacred Land
Description:
The Sacred Land expansion contains the following:

     2x Nora Hunter miniature
     4x Red Eye Watcher miniature
     2x Longleg miniature
     2x Bellowback miniature
     2x Stalker miniature
     2x Snapmaw miniature
     Tiles, cards, tokens and all components needed to play


—description from the publisher

Name: Clank! Adventuring Party: Lightning Reflexes Promo Card
Description:
Promo card for Clank! Adventuring Party which is offered with pre-order of the Adventuring Party

React : An opponent plays a react card outside of their own turn.

1 experience
1 boot

Cost 4

Worth 1 point by react card in your deck at the end of the game (including this one).

Name: Das Zeitungsspiel
Description:
The players are reporters and want to collect 8 articles for their newspaper. On your turn, you throw 2 dice. The colored die determines what kind of card you are entitled to draw onto your hand.  Blue cards show  a specific department, grew ones a specific action like swap cards, play a department card from your hand into your display, make a revealed card of an opponent a canard (worthless), decide to accelerate before throwing the dice. The regular die determines the number of spaces you advance on the track.

You may play one action card on your turn. When you have 8 cards in your display, try to reach the space of the head quarter. After someone arrived there, all players add the value of their cards in their display and deduct the number of spaces they need to reach the headquarter. Highest score wins.

There are several German newspapers that published this game idea.

The game is produced by Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion-Service GmbH.

Name: Sea Hunt
Description:
"Based on the exciting T.V. adventure series"

A simple roll and move game for four people.  Players move their diver figure, descending from the surface to a shipwreck on the sea bed.  A treasure chest is collected from the ship's strong room and carried back to a boat on the surface to win the game.  There are a number of hazards to overcome along the way.

The game was produced to tie in with the popular T.V. adventure series of the same name, starring Lloyd Bridges.

Name: Song for War: Mediterranean Theater
Description:
November…1942. World War 2 ravages the globe in a bloody conflict for the very soul of humankind. Across the war-torn regions of the Mediterranean, the Axis powers of Germany and Italy control much of the theater. But the mighty nations of the United States and Great Britain are on the move, launching a massive offensive —code-named Operation Torch.

But where will the secret Allied fleet choose to land its assault? Will they reclaim air superiority, control the sea, and gain a foothold in the underbelly of Axis-held Europe, or will Axis forces repel the Allies back in a storm of blood and fire?

Song for War: Mediterranean Theater is a tabletop strategy game based in the contested regions of southern Europe, north Africa, and the Mediterranean Sea during World War 2. Representing one of four nations, players must work together as the Allies (US or Great Britain) or Axis (Germany or Italy). Players have the option to set strategy, move units, attack and defend as individual nations or simultaneously as the Allied or Axis team. Innovative mechanics allow players to deploy their land, sea, and air units strategically as combined forces, with faster units moving first and more often, followed by heavy units with stronger firepower. Take strategic objectives, control shipping lanes and resupply, deploy new technologies and units, and recreate historical events to defeat the enemy and win the day.

—description from the designer

Name: ターンアップシャーク (TURN UP SHARK)
Good Night, Bunnies!
Description: Good Night, Bunnies! is a cooperative game: In the evening, players have to catch the little bunnies on the meadow and close their hutches. But this is not so easy as long as there are new pairs of bunny ears constantly coming up from one of the numerous holes in the ground. The more hutches you can close by the end of the game, the better you are as bunny keepers.

Name: Unearthed: Second Edition
Description:
As an up-and-coming paleontologist, your goal is to excavate fossils and sell them to museums. Combine small and large fossils of different types into a variety of prehistoric creatures. You begin with a novice dig team but can purchase additional dig teams and tool upgrades. As you uncover fossils and assemble them into creatures, your fame will increase.

This game primarily focuses on set collection but incorporates some basic engine-building elements.

The second edition comes in a smaller box, has upgraded components, and features more streamlined play.

—description from the designer

Name: All-Star Hockey Card Game
Description: A set of 38 cards, 19 each for each the "Blue" team and the "Red" team, are arranged randomly to recreate the fast-paced game of ice hockey in which each side tries to score the most goals.

Name: Kayo Boxing Card Game
Description: See who is champ! Square off with your opponent for an exciting bout. Punches, jabs, hooks, knock-outs, low punches - they are all in the cards of this exciting, easy-to-play boxing card game.

Name: Barbarossa Fast, Jun-Dec41
Description:
FREE print-and-play VERY fast and family&friends simple/introductory point-to-point game of the Nazi German invasion of Soviet Russia, plays in 40-50 minutes.

Designed as a solitaire game, but as good if not better with live Russian player. Large, 3 (army group) player team 3-piece map table size or small single player(s) 11x17/A3 map (and smaller pieces) "travel" size - with single-sided pieces, VERY easy to assemble.

The base map is the *actual* OberKommando Heeres (OKH) campaign planning map (albeit the 1943-44 edition with corrections made) in the public domain on Ft. Leavenworth's Command and General Staff School's Combined Arms Research Library's Digital Library for anyone to see/use.

7 monthly turns. 6+2 German armies, 10+1 panzerkorps, and the 3 Luftflotten. No peripheral Finnish or Rumanian fronts/forces (so Odessa is left out).

Similar to my more detailed wargame Robot Barbarossa: From the 48 Strong and Weak Russian units, 3 groups - Strong, Medium/"Historical," and Weak - are pre-sorted and only 2 of these unknown groups are selected and mixed. At end of game, compensation victory points are adjusted up or down for the arrays having been found to be Weak or Strong.

OR you can use the un-presorted free Bell Curve selection which usually (as with bell curves) comes out to the average/"historical" but can instead go to extreme extremes!

2 "Siberians" arrive later, and risk arriving sooner than December if Moscow is too threatened too soon.

Has hidden Russian individual and overall strengths with just Strong (1-factor) and Weak units - no armor vs. infantry combat arms differentiation.

Ground combat is (for simplicity and playing speed) DICE-LESS - the unknown units factor giving unpredictability, strategically as well as tactically.

—description from the designer

Name: Marvel Heroes Breakout DVD Game
Description:
25 villains have escaped from jail and you have to recapture them in the Marvel Super Heroes DVD game!
Join your favorite super heroes like the Incredible Hulk, the Fantastic Four and more in a race against time! You'll have fun as you capture villains, jump from rooftop to rooftop and build a super hero! Includes footage from such series as Spider-Man, the X-Men and more!

Name: Fog of Love: Kickstarter Edition
Description:
Fog of Love is a game for two players. You will create and play two vivid characters who meet, fall in love, and face the challenge of making an unusual relationship work.

Playing Fog of Love is like being in a romantic comedy: roller-coaster rides, awkward situations, lots of laughs, and plenty of difficult compromises to make.

Much as in a real relationship, goals might be at odds. You can try to change, keep being relentless, or even secretly decide to be a Heartbreaker. It’s your choice.

The happily-ever-after won’t be certain, but whatever way your zigzag romance unfolds, you’ll always end up with a story full of surprises – guaranteed to raise a smile!



The Kickstarter edition has a slightly different UPC code than the retail edition, and above the bar code on the back of the box is the notation "Kickstarter Edition."

The Kickstarter edition comes with the base game and the following expansions and promo cards packaged inside the game's box. The expansions were not otherwise available until late 2018. 

Mismatched Love (later issued in retail titled It Will Never Last)
Trouble With The In-Laws
Paranormal Romance

The three promo cards previously released at Essen that were contained in the Kickstarter edition:
Work Party (was not available individually but was part of the Fog of Love: Promo Card Set)
Country Fair
What Should We Go To?

Name: STET! Dreyer's English: A Game for Language Lovers, Grammar Geeks, and Bibliophiles
Description:
"Whats' wrong with this sentence?

"If the misplaced apostrophe flew right up your nose, tis is the game for you.  Based on Dreyer's English, the New York Times best seller by Random House copy chief Benjamin Dreyer, STET! will help you sharpen your language skills or give you a reason to show them off."

The game includes 100 sentence cards.

—description from the box

Name: As Ilhas: Wargame nas ilhas britânicas
Description:
As Ilhas - The Islands

Historic wargame based on the timeline of the conflict in Anglo-Saxon Britain encompassing the historic period shortly after the departure of the Roman army in the 4th century until the Norman Conquest in the 11th century.

Turn Order:

     Initiative
     Movement
     Skirmishers Firing
     Firing
     Melee
     Moral


Army lists cover:

     Britons -200–600
     Early Saxons 420-885
     Anglo-saxons 1000-1060
     Early Danes / Vikings 700-900
     Northmen 900-1100
     Normans 1000-1200


— User / publisher description

Name: Shark Bay
Description:
You are in a bay surrounded by 3 sharks with your opponent. Only one of you will survive. Each turn you draw a card to complete 1 of 3 actions. You can either move your player, move a shark of your choice, or set up shelter with a sandbar. However, beware as each shark possesses a special ability! While sandbars may provide protection for now, they are not guaranteed to remain. In order to survive you will need the tactics to both evade the sharks and outwit your opponent into being the tasty treat.

—description from the designer

Name: Lucky Roll
Description:
Lucky Roll is a fun little mix of luck and instincts. Roll dice to obtain gems to collect points. Points are collected after players place gems on the game board and their claimed number is rolled. However, if their number is not rolled, 1 gem from you must be removed from the board. The goal is to collect the most points and have the most fun possible!

—description from the designer

Name: Senate: The Argument Game
Description:
In Senate the Argument Game, you are a senator in the esteemed Roman senate. Think up the most mischievous Propositions for your peers to act out. But be careful, arguing and getting your way in the Senate requires quick wit and strategy.

As any good senator, you must use your Influence to acquire new arguments on the start of every round. The goal is to end up as on the winning team at the end of the round by Objecting arguments or Supporting those who are already winning. The round starts when a Senator makes a Proposition and ends when the senator who started the round plays their eighth turn. Everyone on the losing team must then act out the Proposition. The game ends when every senator has had the chance to make one Proposition.

Members of the winning and losing teams switch frequently throughout the round and Influence keeps changing hands due to yours and other senators' actions, so manage your arguments well. Betrayal, deception, and even begging - everything goes when reputations are at stake.

description from designer

Name: Tops: The Number Game
Description: A simple race to play all of your numbered tiles by placing them on central ascending stacks or on other player’s piles when numbers are one more or one less. Play one out and have another turn.

Name: Dungeon Coin
Description:
Dungeon Coin is a microgame game that fits on a coin.

Game presentation:

     The player is exploring a dungeon in order to find gems.
     He tries to dodge fights with monsters.
     The game is short but the tension is high.


The rules are directly written on the 2 sides of the coin:

     Heads - Flip the coin and see your destiny. You find a monster = you lose the game.
      Tails - Flip the coin and see your destiny. You find a gem. Having 3 gems = victory.


—description from the designer

Name: polaryCUBE
Description:
Skill game based on small cubic magnets to be placed on a game board.

Each player receives the same number of magnets at the beginning of the game and tries to place them on the board without them attracting each other, in a chain reaction.

Name: Sal & Pólvora
Description:
Sal & Pólvora (Salt & Gunpowder) is a Naval wargame system focused on the Age of Navigation, 1750-1825

Scale:
1 hex= 20 m
ship = 1/600 - 1/1200

Sequence of play:

     Wind adjustment
     Initiative
     Movements
     Shooting
     Boarding
     Repairs
     Moral


Contains ships data for France, Britain and Spain

- User description

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Lawless Badlands
Description:
The Sacred Land expansion contains the following:

     42x Bandit miniature (in 9 different designs)
     1x Nil miniature
     Tiles, cards, tokens and all components needed to play


—description from the publisher

Name: Staatsgreep
Description:
In Staatsgreep ("Coup") players battle for control of five countries (Russia, USA, UK, France and China). Players start with 3 country cards each, and gain a new one each round or attack another player to gain their cards. Attacking can be done by showing another player 1 or 2 cards from a single country and 'attack' a different country, or the same. Once a player gets all five country cards they take control of that country. Once you control 2 countries you win the game (3 if you play with 2 players).

—description from the designer

Name: Dawn of Madness: The Ticking Heart
Description:
Edward is a clockmaker who, like Claude, also happens to be a family man. Unlike Claude, though, he knows that it is already too late for his family. Or... is it? What if there was a way to undo what had been done? What if he could bring her back?

The first major expansion to the game unlocked by the stretch goals during Kickstarter campaign. Edward Hirshfield, the clockmaker, will be the wanderer, who will have the leading part  and his story is going to be a doozy.

Name: Sommify
Description:
Sommify is a blind wine-tasting board game. Players take turns guessing mystery wines in an atmosphere reminiscent of a drinking game, all while accidentally learning how to blind taste like a Sommelier. Players guess the Grape and Country of the mystery wine using the incredibly simple Sommify method on The Sommify Wine Key.

Wine culture can be stuffy, pretentious, and intimidating. We created Sommify as a way to have fun with your friends while accidentally learning to blind taste like the Somms!

The Somm is the judge of the round and will reveal clues about the mystery wine. Players either bring a concealed wine and take turns being The Somm, or one player plays Permanent Somm and provides all mystery wines for the game.

Players unlock Cellar Doors on the board by using common wine characteristics (Acidity, Tannins, etc.) to move closer to the final Call Zone to declare the mystery wine to the world. Players score points by pre-calling the wine correctly as well as guessing the wine correctly on the board. After all rounds and wines, the point-leader has proven themselves to be the best blind taster in the universe, and may refer to themselves in the third person for the remainder of the evening (bonus points for using the "Royal We").

-description from designer

Name: Stacknsleuth
Description:
Objective: to enjoy the treats in the mansion while solving a short mystery before a night of gaming. 1) set up a mansion with treats, trinkets, or drinks, 2) load a story on the companion app, then 3) enjoy the mystery and narrative as you explore each room on the table and in the app.

Components
A physical mansion - can be printed and built out of boxes or drawn on stackable shot glasses, your creativity is the limit.
A device that supports the website to load the interactive story.
The treats, trinkets (could be game pieces as prep for the next game), or drinks to place in each room.

Setup
Place the unique items in the mansion boxes or shot glasses.
Stack the mansion to look like the companion app.
Load the game or story.
If you are playing with somebody over zoom or google meet, make sure you both have your mansion stacked (you could send them one loaded with surprises) and then connect and one of you can open the app and load the game, then present to the group, taking turns reading the narrative and opening physical rooms.

How to Play
Tap on your first room in the app and once you tap “enter the room” (not before) open the physical room.  Some rooms cannot open at first, so it is best to wait to make sure the room can open before opening the physical room.
Each room will have a puzzle you can solve that leads to an end solution of the game.  You can go back to rooms to read the solutions at any time.

Winning the Game
You win or lose the game if you solve the final puzzle correctly or incorrectly.

—description from the designer

Name: Horror Flick
Description:
Horror Flick is an all vs one game where one player takes on the role of the antagonist and the rest of the players take on the part of camp counselors trying to rescue the campers and achieve a goal depending on the antagonist.

The counselors will be moving to locations constructed by the antagonist to find and build up a simple engine to help them to deal with the problems that arise. Players can fight, hide, search, and run as basic actions.  Each player has variable powers and items further the things they can do.

The antagonist will construct the search decks at the locations laying traps and surprises to get the players.  Then during game play will move around targeting players trying to complete a goal based off of the antagonist they chose at game start. Each antagonist has different actions they can do.

The winning condition for both sides is based off of which antagonist the player chooses.  It could be find key items to escape, rescuing a number of campers, performing a ritual, and the list goes on.  Just think of any campy horror flick and how it resolves.

—description from the designer

Name: Boy Band Builder: The Card Game
Description:
Welcome to Boy Band Builder:  The Card Game.  A Fun & Fast Paced Game for 2-4 Players, 15-30 Minutes.

Game Description:
Now you can build and manage the Boyband of your Dreams.  Develop new artists, build your group, and spin it into solid gold!  Recruit boys to enhance your group. The boys feature 4 characteristics (Pipes, Moves,Heat, and Cool) which can be enhanced with Star Cards.  You can throw shade at the competition and fight for all all the best Gigs.  It’s a cutthroat business, do you have what it takes to make it to the top?

Gameplay:
Players take turns in sequence and may take two actions per turn from a range of options.  Players can recruit Artists for their band, draw two Star Cards into their hand, play a Star Card on an artist or band, or do a Gig.  Players are trying to do all the best gigs before the competition, so they must play Star Cards on their artists to buff them up enough to do the gig. The combination and order of actions is critical to building a band with the stats you need and handle the negative Star Cards coming from your opponents.

The game ends when the Gig deck runs dry, whoever has done the most Gigs and made the most $ wins.

-description from designer

Name: Slide it
Description:
This is an abstract puzzle game that plays 2 to 4 players where the players manipulate the board in order to get their pieces closest to the goal before the game ends.

—description from the designer

Name: Behind the Bleachers
Description:
This game falls in an alternate world where colleges are run by the students in a mafia like world.  It is a dark horror where the students will do whatever they can to take out the other students that get in the way of them being the most popular. 
The game uses a drafting mechanic with area control to spread your influence in different locations to sway other students onto your side and win out on being the most popular girl in the school.

—description from the designer

Name: Orcs on the Horizon
Description:
Orcs on the Horizon pits you against an onrush of Orc hordes.  Mine silver to pay for upgrades to your archers, knights, and fortress while the hordes march towards you. Build up your archers to take out the orcs before they make it to your fortress.  Or, build up the defenses of your fortress to deal with the orcs that do get there.  Or, build up your knights to battle the orcs that make it into your fortress.  Do a little of each, or all of one, or some other combination to defeat the orc horde.

Orcs on the Horizon is a solo, one card, adventurous, dice based combat game played in two phases.  In phase 1, as Orc hordes march towards your fortress, mine silver to purchase upgrades to your Archers, Knights, or Fortress.  Archers can attack Orcs around the midpoint of their march towards your fortress.  Once the Orcs reach your fortress, flip the card and begin phase 2.  In phase 2, Archers aren't used, only Knights and the defenses of your fortress.  Battle the Orcs to the death to win the game.

The game was created for the 2020 1 Card Print and Play Design Contest.

-description from designer

Name: Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep
Description:
Prepare to drop deeper!

Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep is an epic expansion for the premier "drop-style" tabletop game. Face new challenges as you and your brave companions dive deeper and deeper into the dungeon. Unspeakable (yet remarkably adorable) denizens have emerged from the depths, but it is whispered that fragments of the great relic are among them. Will you take up your sword once again and meet the new horrors that await you?

Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep includes:

     New huge monsters
     Forbidden Pillars
     Rules for Relic fragments
     Additional races, classes, and quests
     All-new coop mode!


...it's time to drop deeper into the dungeon!

—description from the publisher

Name: A Formidable Invasion: the 1863 Gettysburg Campaign
Description:
It is late June 1863. Lee's army--now larger than ever before--swarms into Maryland and threatens Pennsylvania. 
At this critical moment, General Hooker is suddenly replaced by the respected but yet untested George Gordon Meade. 
Can Meade discern Lee's true intentions and stop him? 

A Formidable Invasion is a free campaign supplement, allowing players to re-fight the pivotal weeks of the Gettysburg campaign. 
Players maneuver their divisions across a vast theater map with the potential to fight a series of interconnected battles. 
Our simple rules are only 10 pages, but still include logistics, supply, weather, variable map movement, asymmetrical victory conditions, and historical random events.

—description from the publisher

Name: 5150: Bugs – Breakout
Description:
Don’t Call Them Bugs!

Listen up newbie! I know what you unwarranted high regard for yourself recruits call our enemy – Bugs. A bug is something very small you see crawling on the ground. Something insignificant that you step on and keep doing whatever you’re doing. I got news for you. That’s not what these things, these Bugs, are. We’re going down into the Tunnels looking for real Bugs. When you meet one face to face, try not to wet yourself, and pray to whatever god you believe in that you get out alive. Because to them; we’re the insignificant ones.

5150: Bugs – Breakout is the third of three books linked together to cover the Bug infestation that threatens the 5150 Universe. 
All three are stand-alone games. 
In fact, 5150: Bugs –Into the Tunnels can be used with all of our other 5150 titles.

What: Small group size combat.

Scale: Man to man combat. 1 figure equals 1 man or Bug.

Your Role: Players can Lead from one group of Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia or Star Marines.

Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

In 5150: Bugs - Breakout you can choose to:

Lead a small group of Civilians, Gangers, Survivors, Star Marines or Planetary Militia, each with their own goals.

Play all of the listed groups, moving from one to the other in linked Encounters.

Or if you're really brave; you can choose to go alone.

The bottom line is you can play it any way you like, with any figures you may already have or with the included color counters.

Inside you’ll find:

     A man to man skirmish combat system that plays fast and yields realistic results.
     Complete rules covering six types of Humans - Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia or Star Marines; plus the BUGS! Warriors, Workers, Sleepers and the Brain. Kill the Brain, save the world!
     Two color Battle Boards; one a Tunnel and one a Street. Use them with your figures or the counters we've provided.
     Eighteen different Scenarios that are linked together, building your Story.
     Seven different Lists covering seven different Factions for you to choose from - all with their own goals.
     A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.


Bugs in New Hope City!

In 5150: Bugs Breakout you’re a resident of New Hope City, making ends meet in a usually uneventful life. That’s all going to change as the Bugs have arrived!

You can play the Bug Outbreak from six different points of view – Civilians, Police, Gangers, Survivors, Planetary Militia and lastly Star Marines. Each group has their own goals and although they may be different they agree on one thing...

the Bugs got to go!

—description from the publisher

Name: 5150: Bugs – No Retreat
Description:
Don’t Call Them Bugs!

Listen up newbie! I know what you unwarranted high regard for yourself recruits call our enemy – Bugs. A bug is something very small you see crawling on the ground. Something insignificant that you step on and keep doing whatever you’re doing. I got news for you. That’s not what these things, these Bugs, are. We’re going down into the Tunnels looking for real Bugs. When you meet one face to face, try not to wet yourself, and pray to whatever god you believe in that you get out alive. Because to them; we’re the insignificant ones.

5150: Bugs – No Retreat is the second of three books linked together to cover the Bug infestation that threatens the 5150 Universe. All three are stand-alone games. In fact, 5150: Bugs –No Retreat can be used with all of our other 5150 titles.

What: Sci-Fi Squad/Platoon size combat.
Scale: Man to man combat. 1 figure equals 1 man or Bug.
Your Role: Players can command from one Squad to a full Platoon of infantry.
Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.
5150: Bugs - No Retreat can be played in a variety of ways:

     You can play as a Squad Leader with a full Squad.
     You can play as a Squad Leader with less than a full Squad.
     You can play as a Platoon Leader with a full Platoon of multiple Squads.


The bottom line is you can play it any way you like, with any figures you may already have or with the included color counters.

Inside you’ll find:

     A man to man skirmish combat system that plays fast and yields realistic results.
     Complete rules covering five types of Bugs – Warrior, Worker, Flyer, Puker, Queen and Brain.
     Color Counters including Fort 373.
     Ten different Scenarios that are linked together, building your Story.
     Sixteen different Lists covering seven different Factions for you to choose from.
     A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.


Surrounded? So what!

Word’s come down from the top. The Bugs are on a roll and moving fast towards us. We’re cut off from any support so we need to pull back to Fort 373. Once there, we hold the fort and buy HQ some time to regroup. With any luck, they’ll send someone to pick us up, but don’t count on it. Doesn’t matter anyway, we just have to do our job. 
Do…your…job!

—description from the publisher

Name: 5150: Bugs – Into the Tunnels
Description:
Don’t Call Them Bugs!

Listen up newbie! I know what you unwarranted high regard for yourself recruits call our enemy – Bugs. A bug is something very small you see crawling on the ground. Something insignificant that you step on and keep doing whatever you’re doing. I got news for you. That’s not what these things, these Bugs, are. We’re going down into the Tunnels looking for real Bugs. When you meet one face to face, try not to wet yourself, and pray to whatever god you believe in that you get out alive. Because to them; we’re the insignificant ones.

5150: Bugs – Into the Tunnels is the first of three books linked together to cover the Bug infestation that threatens the 5150 Universe. All three are stand-alone games. In fact, 5150: Bugs –Into the Tunnels can be used with all of our other 5150 titles.

Inside you’ll find:   

     Complete rules covering five types of Bugs – Warrior, Worker, Flyer, Puker, and Brain.
     A Tunnel Building system where no two tunnels are exactly alike.
     24 color poker card size Tunnel Sections.
     Color card stock counters representing your Star Army Squad members and the Bugs
     Ten different Scenarios that are linked together, building your Story.
     Army Lists for the Star Army, Star Marines, and Planet Defensive Force.
     Simple Campaign Rules that tie your Mission’s together, giving you a reason to play, with little bookkeeping.
     Easy yet realistic rules allowing you to play solo or co-operatively against the game, or head-to-head against your friends.
     All this and much more.


It’s just a hole in the ground. Nothing special about it except once you go down there it’ll be life or death…yours. Sarge designated you as the “point” man. That means you’ll be in front. Be aware and alert; your buddies are counting on you. Because, if the Bugs get the jump on you …

—description from the publisher

Name: Gloop (Second Edition)
Description: Take on the role of a teen trying to protect an alien life form that crashed down from other aliens that came after it.  The game is a cooperative action point based game.

Name: Monster Park
Description:
Monster Park is a co-operative miniatures game designed in 2016 by board game Artist James Churchill. Players use movement cards and individual character abilities to evade or attack. Monster cards determine the movement of each cryptid(s). Gates can be opened and closed within the compound using access codes assigned to each player. Victory can be achieved by luring and trapping all monsters into containment areas, or by all players escaping the compound.

-description from designer

Name: Jodłogrody Małe
Description:
Firville is about to change! The mayor of this cosy town has just ordered a new suburban district – Little Firville.
The key to the plan is to develop the centre of the new district, which at the moment is full of sad empty parcels.

Become a member of one of four animal families and plan the building of the new district. Assign tasks to the residents of your quarter, send your representative to the bulding site, perform actions and earn materials.
Before the game ends you will need to have proven cunning in order to earn as many winning points as possible.

'Little Firville' is a family game on economy based on the worker placement mechanics.

Name: TAC-TICS: The football card game for children age 6 to 99!
Description:
TAC-TICS is a quick play football card game where you are the manager of a football team and you score goals by completing your team's formation before your opponent does. With 8 different formations to choose from - take it in turns to REVEAL, SWAP and EXCHANGE your player cards on your way to experiencing the thrill of scoring a goal playing TAC-TICS. Intuitive and easy to learn TAC-TICS can be played solo, by 2 players or by more than 2 players, create your own mini league or knockout tournaments and challenge your family and friends. Play the Club, International or World Cup versions of the rules for a more complex game.

—description from the designer

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Soldiers of the Sun
Description:
The Soldiers of the Sun expansion contains the following:

     2x Carja Hunter miniature
     4x Broadhead miniature
     1x Behemoth miniature
     2x Trampler miniature
     Tiles, cards, tokens and all components needed to play


—description from the publisher

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Forge and Hammer
Description:
The Forge and Hammer expansion contains the following:

     2x Oseram Hunter miniature
     4x Charger miniature
     4x Lancehorn miniature
     2x Ravager miniature
     4x Glinthawk miniature
     Tiles, cards, tokens and all components needed to play


—description from the publisher

Name: Tudor: King & Queens
Description:
A  fun-filled strategy game full of intrigue and betrayal set in Henry VIII´s court. Use your cunning to undermine and weaken your rival queens by spreading ridiculous rumours to ruin their reputation - anything to be the King´s favourite and win the crown!

—description from the box

In the game, you are one of Henry VIII's queens who intrigues to become the one Henry VIII will marry. In turn, you roll the dice and go into one of the castle rooms to try to win a trophy poll based on different traits. For each traits you have the most in gives you a trophy token. You win these by either taking from other players who are in the same room as you or playing gossip cards that lower other players' values.
You win either by having at least three trophy tokens and reaching the same place as Henry VIII. You can also win if you are the last remaining queen in the game (other queens can be eliminated if any of their traits end up at too low a level).

—user summary

Name: Kneipenquiz: Pärchenabend
Description:
This is a new edition of pub quiz. It is about topics, such as general knowledge, love and sports.

This supplementary set can be combined with the game "Kneipenquiz - Das Original" and "Kneipenquiz-Fußball-Spezial".

Name: Mystiska magiker
Description:
The game is about finding out which magicians the other players have chosen. If you expose an opponent, you win his magician. The player who last has a magician on hand, when all opponents have lost theirs, has won.

Each player has a deck of eight cards that show exactly the same magician. Each player chooses one of them and put it facedown on the board. The player roll a dice and goes along a path and performs an action depending on the color you land on. On yellow or green, you can ask one or two questions to any other player. You get the questions by drawing a question card. What you ask is whether the chosen magician has or does not have a specific attribute, such as a blue hat. Depending on the answer, you mark on your display which possible magicians that player may have chosen. If you end up on pink, you can either try to guess another player's magician or if you are not yet prepared to take a pink token that can be used to guess at a later time. If you end up on blue, you have to replace your magician with a new one (but it can be the same) so that the other players have to reset their displays.

—user summary
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: Black Stories: Tödliche Weihnachten
Description:
How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party.

"Black stories: Tödliche Weihnachten" is a very special advent calendar. There are 24 riddles to shorten the time until Christmas.

Name: Sverige frågespel: Resespel
Description:
Answer questions about Sweden in these topics: History, Culture, Nature, Geography, Sports and Mixed.

Subject for question is indicated by a roll of the dice and if you answer correctly, you can cross over the corresponding color on your form. The first player to complete a row with five crosses wins.

The questions are written by Dan Glimne, a well-known Swedish game designer.

Name: Dock
Description:
1612 A.D. – In a bustling, fishy dock somewhere on the east coast of the American continent, settlers’ ships bring vast amount of goods to the New World. There is a lot to do before the ships can set sail again.
–    Listen up, lazy gang! No rest until the ship is unloaded! Pack those boxes tight, we have lots of stuff! Hurry up and move it! The Governor may arrive any minute!

In DOCK you play as settlers of the New World, tasked by the Governor to manage a warehouse. Different boxes are arriving from the ships. Can you load them more tightly than others to satisfy the Governor? Your efforts will be greatly rewarded with silver.

DOCK is roll and write game for up to 10 players and a solo mode for one player. You draw rectangles on a checkered playing area and try to fit them as tight as possible. The 2 dice shows the two side length of the boxes to be drawn.

—description from the designer

Name: Alle Neune
Description:
Roll the dice - run - collect points, always nine if possible. That actually sounds very simple. But it's not that easy!

In Alle Neune, the players score by collecting certain fields that add up to 9. Whenever a player enters a new section with their pawn, they receive a field from the previous section. But be careful! Sometimes players block the coveted fields. And the more pawns that move forward, the more sparse the selection is. Rush forward and collect fields quickly... or would you rather wait? Because whoever leaves a section last can collect additional points.

Name: The Precursors (Fan Expansion for Magic: The Gathering)
Description:
Magic: The Gathering - The Precursors is a cooperative board game and card variant of the classic, competitive card game that has players work together in an epic campaign that can span several gaming sessions. It utilizes a slightly altered Commander (EDH) format of MTG.

Similar to Dungeons & Dragons, a Dungeon Master — or a Game Master (GM), in this case — guides up to four other players on a series of six quests, each of which takes about two to three hours to complete.

The players start in one of the zones. If it’s the Red zone, they’ll be facing a Red or Multicoloured commander; the Blue zone, they’ll be facing a Blue or Multicoloured commander; etc. Each quest features a new enemy deck, so no two quests are ever the same.

The GM is given certain card and life advantages over the Precursor heroes, and it is the goal of the Precursors to defeat the GM while working together. Also of note is that the game allows the GM to also play as one of the heroes if they’re up to it. This means that the game supports up to five players.

The game is quite affordable as it allows cards from every single MTG set. The players make their decks with whatever cards they want to use, a single commander (Legendary Creature) overseeing the army of cards.

The board game consists of five different phases, two of which are almost identical to traditional duels. The game’s pretty simple to learn for veteran Magic players, and not much more difficult than the card game itself for new Magic players.

NOTE: This game is unofficial, of course.

—description from the designer

Name: Vem sa så?
Description: I Vem sa så? (Who said so?) you should tell who said the memorable quotes. You can compete yourself, challenge an opponent or everyone responds at the same time.

Name: United States v. Aaron Burr
Description:
Many events in American history have been labeled "trials of the century", but for a young nation, it would have been impossible to top United States v. Aaron Burr. Unlike Washington, Jefferson, Madison or Hamilton, Aaron Burr came from American royalty — a founding father descended from the original puritanical stock that arrived in Plymouth. His father was the second president of Princeton. His grandfather was Jonathan Edwards, the philosopher-theologian who wrote "Sinners in the Hands of an Angry God," perhaps the most important American literary work of its time.

So in 1776, if you were going to identify any of the Founders who would later stand trial for treason to his country, Aaron Burr would be the least likely — yet Burr's journey as an enormous talent born under a dark star is now well known. Less well understood is that when he shot Alexander Hamilton in the early morning hours of July 11, 1804, it would set in motion a chain of events much more bizarre than anything depicted on Broadway.

Aaron Burr never stood trial for killing Alexander Hamilton in a duel. His trial was for treason, three years later, at the insistence of the Thomas Jefferson, the man Burr had narrowly lost to in the contested election of 1800. An embittered and politically ruined Burr seemed to have developed a scheme to separate the new Louisiana Purchase territories from the United States and declare himself king over the new entity. When Jefferson learned of the plot, he ordered Burr's arrest and publicly declared him guilty of treason.

United States v. Aaron Burr: The Treason Trial of America's Third Vice President, a card-driven game for two players, recreates the treason trial of Aaron Burr in Richmond in 1807. But by accident of recent judicial reforms, Thomas Jefferson's detested cousin, Chief Justice John Marshall, would be riding circuit and would preside over the case. The resulting legal contest would read like a list of who's who of America's Founding Fathers.

United States vs. Aaron Burr is a fast-playing card-driven game in which players seek to use events, evidence, and witnesses of Burr's activities to convince a jury to return a guilty verdict — or if playing for the defense, persuade at least one juror to find Aaron Burr not guilty. Each round, players have the opportunity to question witnesses, persuade jurors, and make points of law to the Chief Justice which will aid them in their cause. The game highlights all the events and participants surrounding one of the most important trials in American Constitutional Law — setting the precedent that the President of the United States is NOT immune from legal court orders, a precedent very much cited by the Supreme Court today.

So try your hand as a great litigator in a great trial. Perhaps you will even find yourself smiling more and talking less!

Name: NOVA: Race from the Sun
Description:
Centuries into the future, scientists experimenting with fusion technology have triggered the Sun to go Super Nova! To escape the expanding corona, players must mine resources, manage their crew population and research sufficient technology to traverse actual locations in our Solar System and escape into the greater Milky Way Galaxy.

On a turn, players have a variable number of actions to perform based on their Crew size. Actions include Mining (taking a resource die from their current planet or moon), Researching (gaining a technology card for new abilities), and Traveling (attempting a roll with resource dice to get to the next orbital location away from the sun). There are also interactive actions between players including Hacking (stealing a technology card), Spying (using another player's tech), and Attacking to steal a resource.

The ultimate goal is to escape the Sun's corona beyond Pluto and into the greater Milky Way with the highest number of crew.

The base game contains a Solar System board, 10 transparent corona covers, and over 75 dice in 8 different colors, 49 technology cards and 4 spaceship player markers.

NOVA: Race from the Sun also features a distinct Solo Mode with 864 possible combinations of technology and a unique scoring system for high replayability.

Write your chapter in humanity's Solar saga!

-description from designer

Name: Grimasjakten
Description: A player takes a card and tries to copy the grimace shown on the card. The other players should now try to see which grimace it is and as soon as possible mark the correct picture on the game board.

Name: Sakura Extra Box
Description:
Every spring, the cherry trees blossom all over Japan. The Japanese celebrate this occasion, as according to their traditions the goddess of Fuji mountain, Konohana Sakuya Hima, revives the fallen flowers at this time. The cherry flower is a symbol of vitality called "sakura".

The players in Sakura aim to play cards without taking any hands. They have to play two cards each time, one on each side of the Jin-Jang card following the rules, which by default require higher number on the Jin side and lower on the Jang side in the same color. (Alternatively, a player can place the same number in any color.) Also, the players are aided in their success by several characters, who require payment (money). The game ends when everyone has only two cards left in their hand. The player who earns the fewest points wins the favor of the goddess and glory will be theirs until next spring.


This edition contains previous Kickstarter extras (not exclusive).

Name: LasseMajas detektivbyrå: Brått i Valleby
Description:
The game is based on the popular Swedish children's books about LasseMajas detektivbyrå (LasseMaja's detective agency) by Martin Widmark & Helena Willis. The books are about two children, Lasse and Maja, who solve mysteries and crimes in the fictional town of Valleby.

In the game, each participant gets one of the known mysteries from the books and must then as fast as possible bring the four suspects and one of the detectives to the crime scene. Whoever succeeds in it first wins.

On each mystery card, four suspects are listed. The suspects on all mystery cards as well as the two detectives Lasse and Maja and also the police chief (who is also one of the detectives) are placed around the playing field with the help of a dice. In turn, you roll the dice and either move one of your suspects or one of the detectives (who are all used by all the players) towards the building that their mystery card has listed.

In addition to this, each player has cards on hand that can either help one to move their suspects faster towards the right building or move the opponents' suspects further away from their building. Among the cards, there are also cards that give you the opportunity to take cards from an opponent, roll one more time with the dice, get the opportunity to use the cable car, etc. Every time you move one of the game characters into a building marked with an arrow, you have to draw new cards to your hand.

—user summary

Name: Age of Fantasy: Regiments
Description:
Age of Fantasy: Regiments is a miniature wargame set in a dark magical world, which is played using 28mm miniatures. 
The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging regimental fantasy battles for new and experienced players alike.

This rulebook adds lots of extra content to the core rules, providing you with countless hours of epic regimental battles that you can customize however you like. 
The rules are written to be concise and to the point, and come with beautiful illustrations as well as helpful example diagrams.

Here's everything that's included in this rulebook:

     Core Rules
     Advanced Rules
         Terrain Placement
         Deployment Styles
         Extra Missions
         Side-Missions
         Extra Actions
         Solid Buildings
         Random Events
         Battlefield Conditions
         Terrain & Objective Effects
    
     Total Conversions
         Fog of War
         Brutal Damage
         Command Points
         Fatigue
         Phased Battles
         Multiplayer Games
         Small-Scales & Multi-Basing
    


Note that all of the army books are available for free on the publisher website, and are not part of this rulebook.

—description from the publisher

Name: Clownspel
Description:
The game board is divided into four circles, one for each color. In the circles there are fields in different colors that each player must walk along until they reach the last field which is the only gray field. The players move by rolling a color dice, i.e. you move to the nearest field with that color. To win, you must first have rolled black on the dice so that you get the black hat and then roll gray to reach the last field. If you roll gray before you have the black hat, you will instead have to stand over a roll.

—user summary

Name: TAISAKU BUILDING 感染症対策ソロデッキ構築型ゲーム (TAISAKU BUILDING Kansenshotaisaku soro dekkikouchikugata gemu)
Lachen, Lachen, Lachen
Description:
Lachen, Lachen, Lachen is a party game, there are question cards and answer cards, both stacks are shuffled, the top question card is read aloud and then the top answer card is read, the fun lies in the comic of the combinations.

If the cards have the same color, they are put out of play, but if they have different colors, they are placed in a pile in front of the person who answered the question. The game continues until someone gets rid of all the cards.

—user summary

Name: So Many Problems: Your Mission
Description:
So Many Problems is a lightly competitive and deeply hilarious storytelling party game for 2 to 8 players. Your Mission (should you choose to accept it) is the first Deluxe Box, including four themes that won't self-destruct:
• Improvising Secret Agent is a master of physics and chemistry who can combine materials in unimaginable ways to escape from the most dangerous espionage assignments.
• You Meddlesome Youths bought a van, adopted a dog that sounds like he is trying to talk, and started a detective agency with some high school friends.
• Long Shot Astronaut and their crew face everything that can go terribly wrong in space, thinking on their feet while floating in zero-gravity.
• Not-So-Super Hero is fighting villains alongside heroes gifted with extreme strength or speed, even though they are basically just really good at a hobby like archery or martial arts.

Every round, each player gets three story elements to secretly distribute and a far-fetched problem to solve, all coming at random from the four themes. You'll try to give the other players elements that might help to solve their problems, but they don't actually want your help.

Before you look at the three elements you receive from others, shuffle in two random elements from the deck. Choose just three of those five possibly-helpful elements to use, trying to avoid those you suspect came from the other players, as you improvise and share a hilarious story that solves your problem.

You'll earn one point for each element you contributed to another player that was used in a solution. Each random element from the deck that you used in your own solution is worth one point, too. After three rounds of problems, the player with the most points wins! Optional advanced game modes add trophies to reward stories that are especially funny or creative, and actions like the challenge flag to throw down and crank up the competition.

-description from designer

Name: Bricks & Brutes
Description:
Players race to complete their castle wall to their unique wall plan - the first one to complete their wall wins.

A players turn has three parts - first the player moves bricks from their unused brick pile up onto their castle wall. If the player has one Mason, they can move one brick. Two Masons - move two bricks.

The second part of a turn is when the player can use gold they have collected to buy more bricks for their unused pile, and hire more Masons (to help them build faster) and Brutes (to defend the unused brick pile and the player's Masons from the dragon).

The final part of the players turn is rolling a 1d10 - the DieOfFate. The die can get the player more gold and bricks, as well as three other possibilities: "Brute" - where (if you have Brutes) you can steal from another players unused brick pile, "Dragon" - where you send the dragon to eat another player's Brutes (or their Mason if they have no Brutes), and "Queen" - where everyone hands their unique castle wall plan to the player to their right - this means you could be one turn from winning with the final brick suddenly you need to reorganize the bricks on the top two levels of your wall.

The game goes fast and the twists and turns of the DieOfFate makes the game "self-leveling", everyone ends the game only a few turns from winning - nobody is completely and catastrophically behind when the game ends.

-description from designer

Name: BoardGains
Description:
Do you wish to bring your workouts to life? Working out on your own could get a little “boring” at times!

Imagine getting a chance to work on your fitness while having a fun time with your friends or likeminded people?

Sounds too good to be true? Well, it isn’t!

Because we bring you the BoardGains – Bodyweight Edition.

It is a fitness board game that lets you work on your fitness while having fun. This game engages you into a healthy competition all while allowing you to hit your fitness goals!

In this game, players or teams roll the dice, move their game piece, exercise, and collect gains. Win the game by collecting the set number of gains before anyone else or by collecting the most gains in a set amount of time.
 Oh, and did we tell you that it comes with a twist? You betcha! BoardGains comes with “Lucky? Play Cards” that can either help you gain an advantage in the game or cause a disadvantage. It takes around 45 to 60 minutes to complete, and you can play anywhere.

—description from the designer

Name: Mexican Jack Squint Presents: The Lion Eats Tonight
Description:
The Lion Eats Tonight. This digest size title from the demented mind of Howard Whitehouse is all about the hunt for Big Game in the wilds of colonial Africa.

The game can be played with or without a gamemaster.

As players take turns trying to bag the best game, the other players will decide whether to award or subtract points depending on whether the hunter shot the charging rhino from the top of a tree or stood is ground as the beast charged directly toward him.

There are rules for tracking animals, stalking hunters, gun-bearers, and, of course, shooting with the best and worst guns of the time. 
Realism is tossed out the window in place of a rip-roaring good time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shaman
Description:
12,000 years ago: the world is volatile, as are the prospects of survival for you and your tribe. A Shaman begins their duty as just a youth, but must be wise beyond his or her years in order to grow, expand and thrive as a tribe. As the spiritual leader you will decide when and where your tribe should hunt, gather, settle, build and more. The best Shamans commune freely with the spirits, animals and nature itself, but this path is not always peaceful, beasts will be slain and foes will be vanquished. Will your tribe grow and thrive or merely survive?

You are the Shaman leader of your specific tribe. Each Shaman has a collection of skulls in which they may commune with the spirit world. You must use these skulls to take actions, or harness a beast spirit, or even create and collect totems for bounties at your life's end. The actions you choose will tell your tribe to move, engage, grow, or worship, each having its own set of choices. In doing so, you will collect resources from the land to feed your tribe, to develop technologies, to build resources, make offerings to the great spirits, activate skulls and more. As the Shaman you must be wary of impending catastrophes known only to you and the other Shaman of the world. The Shaman whose tribe has the largest population is winner.

A tribe's total end game population consists of their total token dial amounts (rovers, warriors, villages), their totem bonus amounts, and any end game bonus population. The population represented by the dials underneath your tokens on the board will be the main portion of your score.

-description from designer

Name: Checkermates
Description:
Checkers for 2 to 4 players.  Each player sets up his/her checkers on the side of the board opposite to, and matching the named color, on the board perimeter.  The board is big enough to accommodate all 4 players.  Movement rules and capturing are identical with checkers and "kinging" is also a part of this game, occuring when a player's piece reaches the opposite side.  The goal is to be last man standing.  "Kingless" variants are given, with winning conditions depending on various goals for single pieces.

—user summary

Name: Dragonbrood
Description:
The dragons of Dracodale have long been banished to Eternal Slumber in the far corners of the Earth. But once a millennium, for just six years, the spirits of the Elder Dragons awaken to create new broods of Dragons to pillage the lands and collect immense hordes of treasure before being banished again to Eternal Slumber.

Each player is the spirit of an Elder Dragon: Black, Gray, Umber, Sienna, Tan, White, vying for the largest horde of treasure, including various coins, gems, jewels, trinkets, crystals, and gold. Players will begin with just a few young, freshly hatched dragons, but over the course of six years, each year consisting of four seasons, those few will grow in number and size, possibly even awaking your own slumbering Elder Dragon body. Players will ultimately, through clever choices of timing and possibly color abilities, be placing their Dragon meeples in various locations to gain, trade, steal, buy and spend various resources.

Each Elder Spirit’s horde of treasure is made up of their collection of the seven valuable items (gold, ducats (coin), gobloons (coin), dragon coin (coin), crystals, gems and jewels), as well as, trinkets obtained, bank vault value, magic track value and end game bonus amounts. The Elder Dragon Spirit (Player) with the most valuable horde of treasure at the end of the six years is the winner of Dragonbrood.

-description from designer

Name: Conspiracy Theory Travel Edition
Description:
Conspiracy Theory tests your knowledge of the world of Internet conspiracies.

Answer questions to collect conspiracy cards to win, but be careful of Cover-Ups. A QR code is printed on every conspiracy card if you want more details (like when the ghost of JFK revealed that all dolphins are aliens).

The perfect party game for 2 to 6 players (or teams). This travel edition of our popular Conspiracy Theory Trivia Board Game, contains 200 all-new questions and a game die to easily play on the go (or use it as an expansion pack for the full board game).

-description from publisher's website

Name: War Hounds
Description:
A new century has dawned for all pups and dogs on the great island continent of Doggerland. But the hope of a shining new future has quickly darkened. The nations of Doggerland fortify their borders, mobilize troops and artillery daily. Though many fear war, many more welcome it as the opportunity for glory and patriotic display. Little do they understand what destruction is to come…

Each player in War Hounds is the leader of a nation of dogs. There are 12 factions (6 double sided playerboards.) Each faction with its own set of abilities, functions, costs etc. Players will play over the course of 4 years, the war ending at the close of the 4th year. Players will play in rondel turn order, each round the turn order possibly changing. Players will take one action on their turn by selecting an action in the top of their playerboard. As with everything in this era of Doggerland history, things are hierarchical, meaning a chain of command or top-down, and so in selecting actions, generally a player may not select an action above those they have already selected. Players will draft troops, build artillery, invest in new technologies, influence new policies, shift and transform their economies, and of course engage in embroiled bouts of combat. Players will conquer territories, gain medals and lose casualties. Ultimately, the winner is the nation with the most victory paws at the end of the game.

The winner is the nation with the most total victory paws at the end of the game (all paws are awarded at game end--none during). Players gain victory paws from the following sources: medals, casualties (negative paws), controlled territories, technologies, policies, loan debt (negative paws) and wealth (1 victory paw per $25).

-description from designer

Name: Flames of War: Waffen SS Starter Force – Waffen SS Panther Kampfgruppe
Description:
The Waffen-SS were the elite combat arm of Adolf Hitler’s personal bodyguard.  
Fighting wherever the fire was hottest, they had proved their mettle many times in the cauldron of battle on the Eastern Front.

With the American and British forces poised to invade Normandy, they were brought west to France to rebuild, tripling their strength to become far stronger than the handful of regular Army Panzer divisions facing the Allies. 
When the Allies landed on D-Day, the SS were sent in to throw them back into the sea.

In the battles that followed, their unswerving determination and stubborn refusal to retreat made them the most feared opponents the Allies faced.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flames of War: D-Day – Waffen-SS Forces in Normandy, 1944
Description:
This book gives you everything you need to begin building your D-Day: Waffen-SS force.

Between mid 1943 and mid 1944, the German focus was on the Eastern Front. After the failure of the German Kursk Offensive, the Red Army went on the offensive, throwing hammer blow after hammer blow to drive the Germans back to the Russian border. The elite 1st and 2nd SS Panzer Divisions were rushed to wherever the Soviets broke through, counterattacking to seal the breach. By Christmas, the divisions were worn out, barely a regimental sized battlegroup remained. They desperately needed to be withdrawn to France to rebuild back to full strength.

Then, as 1944 began, the Red Army attacked again. The two new divisions being formed in France, the 9th and 10th SS Panzer Divisions were rushed to the Eastern Front and the plans to rebuild the existing divisions were shelved. Finally, in March, the Spring rains turned the roads to mud and the Soviet offensives ground to a halt. All four divisions were returned to France for rebuilding, joining the 12th SS Panzer Division which was part way through its training. Six weeks into their training, still trying to bring large numbers of conscripted replacements up to scratch, the Allies invaded France on D-Day. Ready or not, the SS panzer divisions were rushed to the invasion front, counterattacking to drive the Allies back into the sea.

With a solid core of veteran leaders under your command, can your willing, but inexperienced troops defeat the Allies despite their massive superiority in numbers? Can you win a never-ending battle of attrition, or do you attack into the teeth of massed artillery, naval bombardments and airpower? Can you defeat the invasion and save your homeland?

Forces details on:

     Tiger SS Tank Company
     Panther SS Tank Company
     Panzer IV SS Tank Company
     StuG SS Tank Company
     SS Panzergrenadier Company
     SS Reconnaissance Company Company
     Support


—description from the publisher

Name: Flames of War: Iron Cross – German Forces on the Eastern Front 1942-43
Description:
Iron Cross is the next step for the German army in Mid-War as we look towards the Eastern Front.

German players will be able to field familiar favourites such as the Panzer III and Panzer IV tanks whilst Iron Cross also introduces Grenadiers and Assault Pioneers allowing you to recreate the intense infantry fights of Stalingrad and beyond.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zahlen-Piraten
Description:
A children's game that has components for several different games that focus on the number 1 through 10.

1) Number Duel - similar to the traditional game of war except if the same number is flipped over by both players, both cards go to the discard pile. When all cards have been taken whoever has the most cards wins.

2) Die Counting - similar to Shut the Box. A player rolls the die and turns over a card matching that number or may roll again to try and turn over the 7, 8, 9, or 10. If the player pushes their luck and the sum is over 10, the play forfeits that turn. First player to flip over all 10 of their cards win.

3) Pirate Destinations - Another push your luck game of flipping over a card from the deck of cards (1 thru 10) and moving a pirate the number of spaces equal to the number of the card. The player who got to 10 (or closest to it) wins.

4) Quick at Calculating - Addition/subtraction math problem cards are used (the result will be a number 1 to 10). The player calculates the answer and then plays the card from their hand. If they are right, they keep the card, otherwise the card is discarded. The player with the most cards when the deck of problem cards is depleted is the winner.

Name: City of Gears: Creator's Compound Promo Tile
Description:
Originally available from TWIST Gaming Year 4 Kickstarter campaign.

Promo tile for City of Gears.

City tile, Industrial Community tile. 
Link Bonus: 1 Zap token.
Activation cost: 1 Worker, 1 Zap.
Score: 3 Prestiges.
Gain 2 Prestiges for each Industrial Community (grey) tile your workers occupy, including this one.

Name: Flames of War: Ghost Panzers – German Forces on the Eastern Front 1942-43
Description:
Ghost Panzers centres on the action around Operation Citadel, also known as the Battle of Kursk.

It was here in July 1943, that one of the war’s largest tank battles took place, with over 2450 German tanks and assault guns.

As the ground hardened after the muddy Russian Spring, the German army prepared to launch their Summer offensive, codenamed Operation Citadel. The target was Kursk, a city in the center of a huge bulge in the front line, where several Soviet armies could be cut off and destroyed.

To ensure success, new weapons were rushed to the front, including Ferdinand heavy tank-hunters and Panther medium tanks. These were combined with several panzer and panzergrenadier divisions, totaling an impressive 2,450 tanks and assault guns. Over 3,600 Soviet tanks were waiting for them, setting the scene for the largest tank battle on the Eastern Front...

Inside this book, you'll find:

• Background on the German Army in 1943, the Third Battle of Kharkov, and the great summer offensive at Kursk.

• Instructions on how to build a Panther Company, Mixed Panther Company, Armoured Panzergrenadier Company, Tiger Heavy Tank Company, and a StuG Assault Gun Company.

• A detailed painting guide.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Delivirus
Description:
Players fill Deliveries by collecting sets of Resources from the Market while avoiding Symptoms. If a player takes on too many Symptoms, that player will have to take a Test to see if he/she has contracted a virus! At the end of the game, players tally the points earned from their completed Deliveries and subtract any points from Deliveries still in their hand. The player with the most points wins.

-description from designer

Name: Flames of War: Afrika Korps – German Forces In The Desert 1942-43
Description:
The German Afrika Korps is a hard-fighting force of tough veteran troops who have won many battles and expect to win many more. Their Panzer III and Panzer IV tanks outclass the British tanks they face, and have been steadily upgraded to maintain their edge over the opposition. Their infantry are organized to have "few men, many weapons," so they pack a ferocious punch whether facing infantry or tanks. These are backed by the famous "88" dual-purpose anti-tank/anti-aircraft gun and the Stuka dive bomber.

Inside this book you'll find:
- Background on the German Afrika Korps and its part in the fall of Tobruk, the battle of Alam el Halfa, and the Battle of Medenine.
- Instruction on how to build a Panzer III Tank Company, Panzer IV Tank Company, or Africa Rifle Company.
- A detailed painting guide to help you prepare your German troops for combat.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Tranquil Terror: Tiny Turtle Terrors
Description:
Expand the playable of Tranquil Terror with the mini expansion - Tiny Turtle Terrors. Play as a group of newly hatched sea turtles trying to survive.

Swimming against the current is challenging and tiring.  In a situational flip, eat the jellyfish that get in your way to open a route. Be careful though, open water leaves the turtles visible to predators. Hungry sharks from below, and hunting birds from above, pose a constant threat to these hatchlings.

Every turn, swim against the current and try to survive long enough to get far out to sea. This cooperative game requires players to strategize in order to get 10 baby turtles safely on their way. Once they have all made it to the far side, you win.

Name: カッパたん (Kappa tan)
Description:
ã‚«ãƒƒãƒ‘ãŸã‚“ (Kappa tan) is a Japanese game with water.

In Japanese folklore, there is a Yokai called Kappa. Kappa is small humanoid that lives in rivers and waterways. The top of its head is formed like a crown or a dish, and the Kappa must keep water in it to stay healthy. If the Kappa spills or dries out, it suffers and dies.

In this game, the Kappa is an inverted paper cut with the base cut into the crown. Players take turns to add water to the crown using straws. A player dips the straw into a glass of water, puts their finger on the open end, and draws the straw out. Then they put the straw to the crown and release the water. The next player does the same and so forth.

Gradually the crown fills, until only surface tension is holding the water in. Eventually, a player adds enough water to break the surface and the water spills, and that player loses.

The crown design means that it takes a surprising amount of water to break. Players start taking up less and less water, and the other players mock their lack of nerve.

The game was originally hand-made and as well as a full sized Kappa, the game also has a mini Kappa for a quicker result. The game can be played by young children and adults alike.

In 2019, a professional version was made by itten, Kappa Bros!.
user summary

Name: Farmer Jones
Description: Farmer Jones is similar to the well-known "memory", but requires even more concentration due to the acoustic announcement by the farmer from the included sound box, which animal or which item is currently being sought. Two to four children can support "Farmer Jones" with the search and keep the farm tidy.

Name: Friends Wheel of Mayhem Game
Description:
Lets Play Wheel of Mayhem! Feel the confusion IRL and see why Chandler called it, "...the best game ever!" As featured on Friends, the game has all the original wacky instructions with trivia based on the show. This game tests you on your Friends trivia in ways you didn’t think were possible. Pick a Wicked Wango card? You might have to recite the Friends theme song from memory! Continue up the Ladder of Chance until you get to the Golden Mud Hut.

—description from the publisher

Name: Piff Paff & Friends
Description:
You play with several tiles with the motifs of a total of twelve sea friends lying in front of you. The same pictures can be found on task cards, for which the same tiles must be found.

The electronic timer provides the necessary tension: A random bubbling sound sounds for ten to sixty seconds: During this time, cards can be played until the bugle interrupts the happy activity of the sea creatures. Whoever was on the turn loses this round

Name: Tapestry: Plans and Ploys
Description:
Choose from a variety of new civilizations, pursue individual achievements to add landmarks to your capital city, and sneakily interact with the opposition in this first expansion for Tapestry.

—description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Fortune of the Forgotten World
Description:
Welcome to FORTUNE OF THE FORGOTTEN WORLD. In the future, genetic engineering has made possible the return of dinosaurs to planet Earth. Meanwhile, entertainment demands are at an all-time high.

A child of these strange times, FORTUNE OF THE FORGOTTEN WORLD is the highest rated show in history. Located on Island 17A, a scientific experiment gone awry, the television show offers contestants a chance to find a veritable fortune in cash that is stashed on the island, locate the hidden raft and escape to safety, all the while fighting and running from dinosaurs, collecting useful items, fending off other contestants, and competing for the best ratings with the television audience.

YOU are one of this season’s contestants, having survived a rigorous screening process that includes a paleontologist, an engineer, a soldier, a trail guide, a cook, a medical doctor, a professional athlete, and a popular celebrity. Can you outwit the competition, survive combat with history’s deadliest predators, puzzle out the island’s technology all to recover the hidden stash of cash and escape with your life?

Gameplay involves players "landing" on the island by placing their tokens on the hex board, and then rolling dice to move around, revealing tiles that they encounter along the way. Tiles might be useful items such as weapons, health packs, or tools -- or they could be wild dinosaurs which force players to evade or battle them. Only one tile is the sought-after prize money. Once the money is found, players must race to find the raft off of the island, which may lie beyond gates that must be powered on and unlocked. Will you prepare a route to safety before you search for the prize money? Establish choke points to steal the money from other players? Scour the island for the prize money in hopes that you don't encounter a deadly dinosaur instead? Your decisions affect how the TV audience perceives you. Unpopular players may get "fired", while popular ones will be rewarded by studio executives. Random events may interfere with your strategy, so always have a contingency plan and don't forget about your character's unique skills!

—description from the designer

Name: Zoo Tac Toe
Description:
The board represents a zoo with unique 36 animals. Players must get animals to escape from the zoo by matching animals with attributes on cards. When matched, an animal tile is flipped to reveal an arrow. Align the arrow to point to the player.

Once three or more adjacent arrows or a square point to a player, that player's animals "escape". The player collects a coin matching the number of animals released and those tiles are replaced with new animals. It is possible to collect two coins when two lines are made by intersection.

Once all attribute cards have been played, the player with the most coin values is the winner. In case of a tie, continue with ten more attribute cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Battle of the Bards: TWIST Gaming promo card
Description:
Available from TWIST Gaming Year 4 Kickstarter campaign.

Audience card :
cost: 3 performance tokens (any color)
VP: 5
ability: While Taking the Stage, if you play your Lead Bard and a Veteran Bard, you may gain a tune token

Name: The Manipulator: Five Parsecs Character Pack 3
Description:
The Manipulator is Character Pack 3 for Five Parsecs From Home and introduces a new character type to your campaigns.

The tentacled Manipulators offer a character with interesting quirks in combat and the potential to earn additional Story Points, but vulnerable to those close combat brutes that fringe space tends to be filled with.

This new character type can be fitted into any campaign, whether you are starting out or already engaged.

—description from the designer

Name: Bases Loaded: A Word Game That's NOT About Baseball
Description:
Bases Loaded is a fast-paced word game... that's not about baseball! You'll be competing against other players to call out answers to various combinations of cards. These combinations will be ever-changing, so players will need to keep their eye on the ball if they want to win!

Each inning will start with someone placing one base card (a category), and one loaded card (a describing word) at first base. The other players will compete to call out an answer that fits both cards (such as "broccoli" if the cards were "bitter" and "vegetable"). The player who successfully provides an answer gets to play the next card. They can choose to add another loaded card to 2nd Base, or they can choose to replace an existing card (loaded card OR base card).

Players continue to add cards, earning singles, doubles, and triples, depending on the number of loaded cards in play. Once there are four loaded cards, one player can attempt to hit a "grand slam" by sharing an answer that incorporates all 4 loaded cards! Once the grand slam is awarded, players will tally their total points from all of their "hits", and take note of their score for that inning. After a set number of innings, players will calculate their total scores to determine the winner of the game!

Throughout the game, players can lose points by calling out incorrect answers (strikes) or by placing nonsensical cards on their own turn (outs). Strikes and outs cause you to lose varying amounts of points, depending on how many cards are in play! However, players will have two abilities (curve-balls and splitters) to help them get out of a tight spot.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dino Soldiers: Core Set
Description:
Do you remember the games you played when you were a child, where you, as the general, directed massive battles ? 
As your brave toy soldiers followed your orders? 
Or when incredible dinosaurs roamed, hidden in the dense, mysterious jungle of your backyard ?

With Dino Soldiers, you can relive these adventures around a table in a tactical combat game, where only one player emerges victorious.

The Vietnam War. In the middle of the jungle, during a recon mission in a misty valley, a squad of soldiers of the Delta Sierra company comes face to face with dinosaurs from a bygone age.
A savage battle ensues on a terrain full of traps and hazards, where everyone must fight to survive.

One player leads a squad of soldiers and the other plays the dinosaurs. One group plays strategically while the other is more primitive in its tactics. The game ends when all soldiers or dinosaurs are eliminated.

First, you choose or create your teams. Then, each player draws and places terrain tiles, face down, one after the other, trying to create a playing field to their advantage.
After that, the players discover the field while fighting each other. Movement, placement and distance determine if a unit can be killed.
